questions.question: What is the representation of the Earth's surface (or a part of it) on a flat surface called?
questions.explanation: A map is a 2D representation of the Earth's surface or a portion of it, while a globe is 3D.

questions.question: A map is a three-dimensional representation of the Earth's surface.
questions.explanation: Maps are flat (2D); globes are three-dimensional representations.

questions.question: A _____ is a flat representation of the Earth's surface or a part of it.
What is the key difference between a map and a globe?
questions.correct_answer: A map is flat (2D), while a globe is spherical (3D).
acceptable_variations: Globes show curvature; maps are flat.

questions.question: Which of the following are true about maps? (Select all that apply)

options.text: They are the same as globes
